testcase.brief: Network firewall IP/Mask test when the packets are from 2 vpn
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: -Configure AP1 Enable tunnel1 between AP1 and Gateway1 Enable tunnel2 between AP1 and Gateway2 Enable 1 dhcp server（mgt0.1） Mgt0.1 vlan10 IPaddr 10.1.10.1 gateway 10.1.10.1 Laptop1 connect to Mgt0.1 IPaddr 10.1.10.2 (wifi) -Laptop2 get IPaddr 192.168.10.10 -Laptop3 get IPaddr 192.168.20.20
Test Procedure: 1) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3 2) Configure network firewall rule "network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to network 192.168.1.1 255.255.0.0 action permit logging off" "network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging off" 3) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3 4) Delete network firewall config on AP1 "no network-firewall" 5) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3 6) Configure network firewall rule on AP1 "network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to network 192.168.1.1 255.255.0.0 action deny logging off" "network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging off" 7) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3 8) Delete network firewall config on AP1 "no network-firewall" 9) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3

step.desc: config BR with WAN interface, nat enable
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${cvg1.cvg.wan.netmask}"

step.desc: config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${cvg1.cvg.wan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: Set interface eth0 to wan mode,eth1/eth2 to access mode and enable mac-learning
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mac-learning enable"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side

Configure network firewall rule “network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to network 192.168.1.1 255.255.0.0 action permit logging on” “network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging on”
step.telnet: -v "network-firewall name 1001 from network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_1} to network ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_2} action permit logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1002 from network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_1} to network ${cvg2.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_2} action permit logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1003 from any to any action deny logging on" -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "clear log all"

step.log-match: -p "ACCEPT PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1001\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}
-p "ACCEPT PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg2.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1002\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: Configure network firewall rule on AP1 “network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to network 192.168.1.1 255.255.0.0 action deny logging on” “network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging on”
step.telnet: -v "clear log all" -v "network-firewall name 1001 from network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_1} to network ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_2} action deny logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1002 from network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_1} to network ${cvg2.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_2} action deny logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1003 from any to any action deny logging on"

step.log-match: -p "DROP PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1001\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}
-p "DROP PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg2.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1002\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}
